snippet: Many hope the federal government will succeed in obtaining an indictment of New York police officers where Staten Island prosecutors failed.
abstract: Justice Department's decision to open a civil rights investigation into chokehold death of Eric Garner raises hopes that federal government will obtain an indictment where Staten Island prosecutors failed; legal experts caution that federal prosecutors will face significant challenges in proving that Officer Daniel Pantaleo used unreasonable or excessive force, or that he willfully deprived Garner of his civil rights.
lead_paragraph: Many hope the federal government will succeed in obtaining an indictment of New York police officers where Staten Island prosecutors failed.

headline.main: A Criminal Civil Rights Case May Be Difficult to Prove
headline.print_headline: A Federal Case May Be Hard to Prove, Legal Experts Say
